definitions.text: a track or mark left by something that has passed
examples: there as a trail of blood
a tear left its trail on her cheek

definitions.text: a path or track roughly blazed through wild or hilly country
evidence pointing to a possible solution
examples: the police are following a promising lead
the trail led straight to the perpetrator
But in so many other areas we still are dragging

definitions.text: go after with the intent to catch
examples: The policeman chased the mugger down the alley

definitions.text: move, proceed, or walk draggingly or slowly
examples: John trailed behind his class mates
The Mercedes trailed behind the horse cart

definitions.text: hang down so as to drag along the ground
examples: The bride's veiled trailed along the ground

definitions.text: drag loosely along a surface; allow to sweep the ground
examples: The toddler was trailing his pants
She trained her long scarf behind her
